text.0: A 4-month-old boy presented with a progressively worsening rash on his abdomen, diaper area, limbs, face, and scalp. A biopsy was performed, and a diagnosis of zinc deficiency–associated dermatitis was made.
text.1: On the horizon: An assay using #CRISPR technology was as specific as and more sensitive than qRT-PCR for detecting #SARSCoV2 from clinical samples and could be done in <30 minutes using simple equipment. https://t.co/N9G9lwiVIv https://t.co/CnqtiZz96F
text.2: A 66-year-old man presented with an enlarging neck mass. Fine-needle aspiration of the mass was performed, and a diagnosis of scrofula was made.
text.3: Free Access: NEJM Covid-19 Articles and Resources. #COVID19 #SARSCoV2
text.4: In this audio interview conducted on October 28, 2020, the editors discuss the fundamentals of antibody therapy and the results of an early-phase trial of a new monoclonal antibody against SARS-CoV-2.
